Submodules¶

mbuild.tools.compute module¶

mbuild.tools.compute.compute_center_of_mass(traj, masses=None)[source]¶

Compute the center of mass for each frame.

Note: This function alters the equivalent mdtraj by adding the option to provide an array of masses.

Parameters:traj (Trajectory) – Trajectory to compute center of mass for.
Returns:com – Coordinates of the center of mass for each frame.
Return type:np.ndarray, shape=(n_frames, 3)

mbuild.tools.mask module¶

mbuild.tools.mask.apply_mask(host, guest, mask, guest_port_name='down', backfill=None, backfill_port_name='up')[source]¶

Attach guest Compounds to a host Compound in the pattern of a mask.

mbuild.tools.mask.disk_mask(n)[source]¶
mbuild.tools.mask.grid_mask_2d(n, m)[source]¶
mbuild.tools.mask.grid_mask_3d(n, m, l)[source]¶
mbuild.tools.mask.random_mask_2d(num_sites)[source]¶
mbuild.tools.mask.random_mask_3d(num_sites)[source]¶
mbuild.tools.mask.sphere_mask(N)[source]¶

Generate N evenly distributed points on the unit sphere.

Sphere is centered at the origin. Alrgorithm based on the ‘Golden Spiral’.

Code by Chris Colbert from the numpy-discussion list: http://mail.scipy.org/pipermail/numpy-discussion/2009-July/043811.html

add(new_part, label=None, containment=True, replace=False, inherit_periodicity=True)¶

Add a part to the Compound.

Note

This does not necessarily add the part to self.parts but may instead be used to add a reference to the part to self.labels. See ‘containment’ argument.

Parameters:
  • new_part (Atom, Bond or Compound) – The object to be added to this Compound.
  • label (str, optional) – A descriptive string for the part.
  • containment (bool, optional) – Add the part to self.parts. Defaults to True.
  • replace (bool, optional) – Replace the label if it already exists. Defaults to False.
add_bond(type_a, type_b, dmin, dmax, kind=None)¶

Add Bonds between all Atom pairs of types a/b within [dmin, dmax].

ancestors()¶

Generate all ancestors of the Compound recursively.

Yields:ancestor (Compound) – A Compound one or more levels higher in the hierarchy.
append_from_file(filename, relative_to_module=None, frame=0)¶

Append to Compound with information from a Trajectory file.

append_from_trajectory(traj, frame=0)¶

Append the Trajectory’s topology (atoms, bonds).

atom_list_by_kind(kind='*', excludeG=False)¶

Return a list of Atoms filtered by their kind.

Parameters:
  • kind (str) – Return only atoms of this type. ‘*’ indicates all.
  • excludeG (bool) – Exclude Port particles of kind ‘G’.
Returns:

atom_list – A list of Atoms.
Return type:

list
atoms¶

A list of all Atoms in the Compound and sub-Compounds.

atoms_in_range(point, radius, max_items=10)¶

Return the indices of Atoms within a radius of a point.

Parameters:
  • point (list) – The reference point in cartesian coordinates.
  • radius (float) – Find Atoms within this radius.
  • max_items (int) – Maximum number of Atoms to find.
Returns:

List of Atoms within specified range.
bond_list_by_kind(kind='*')¶

Return a list of Bonds filtered by their kind.

Parameters:kind (str) – Return only Bonds of this type. ‘*’ indicates all.
Returns:bond_list – A list of Bonds.
Return type:list
bonds¶

A list of all Bonds in the Compound and sub-Compounds.

boundingbox(excludeG=True)¶

Compute the bounding box of the compound.

Parameters:excludeG (bool) – Exclude Atoms of kind ‘G’ (typically reserved for Ports).
Returns:Simulation box initialzied with min and max coordinates.
Return type:Box
center¶

The cartesian center of the Compound based on its Atoms.

extras¶

Return the Compound’s optional, extra attributes.

min_periodic_distance(xyz0, xyz1)¶

Vectorized distance calculation considering minimum image.

n_atoms¶

Return the number of Atoms in the Compound.

n_bonds¶

Return the number of Bonds in the Compound.

referenced_ports()¶

Find all Ports referenced by this Compound.

Returns:A list of Ports currently referenced by this Compound.
remove(objs_to_remove)¶

Remove a part (Atom, Bond or Compound) from the Compound by value.

Parameters:objs_to_remove (set of Parts) – All objects to be removed from the hierarchy. If this is not a set, it will be cast to one to remove duplicates.
save(filename, show_ports=False, **kwargs)¶

Save the Compound to a file.

This creates an intermediate Trajectory object.

to_trajectory(show_ports=False, **kwargs)¶

Convert the Compound to a Trajectory.

update_from_file(filename, relative_to_module=None, frame=0)¶

Update Compound with information from a Trajectory file.

update_from_trajectory(traj, frame=0)¶

Update the Compound with the Trajectory’s topology.

visualize(show_ports=False)¶

Visualize the Compound using VMD.

Assumes you have VMD installed and can call it from the command line via ‘vmd’.

TODO: Look into pizza.py’s vmd.py. See issue #32.

mbuild.tools.solvent module¶

mbuild.tools.solvent.solvate(host_compound, guest_compound, host_box, guest_box, overlap=<function vdw_radius at 0x1089c02a8>)[source]¶

Solvate a Compound in a Box.

Typical usage of this function would be to use a pre-equilibrated solvent system as the guest which will then be replicated to fill the host’s Box. All Compounds that have overlapping Atoms with the host are removed.

Parameters:overlap (function) – A function which translate atoms to overlap radii.
mbuild.tools.solvent.solvent_box(solvent, box)[source]¶

Fill a box with solvent.

mbuild.tools.solvent.vdw_radius(atomic_number)[source]¶

mbuild.tools.tiled_compound module¶

class mbuild.tools.tiled_compound.TiledCompound(tile, n_tiles=None, kind=None)[source]¶

Bases: mbuild.compound.Compound

Replicates a Compound in any cartesian direction(s).

Correctly updates connectivity while respecting periodic boundary conditions.
